required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Disability-adjusted Life Years in a Senegalese Cohort of Patients With Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
clinical_study.official_title: Disability-adjusted Life Years in a Senegalese Cohort of Patients With Subarachnoid Hemorrhage

lead_sponsor.agency: Association of Future African Neurosurgeons, Yaounde, Cameroon

clinical_study.source: Association of Future African Neurosurgeons, Yaounde, Cameroon

brief_summary.textblock: Subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) is the extravasation of blood into the subarachnoid space from traumatic or nontraumatic origin. There is a paucity of data on the burden of SAH in African countries. In this study, we analyzed data from patients in the largest neurovascular center in Senegal to determine the sex- and age-adjusted burden of SAH in Senegal.

detailed_description.textblock: The Fann Teaching Hospital (Dakar, Senegal) institutional review board authorized this study. Consent was obtained from adult patients and the parents/legal guardians of children. Patient data were stored in a password-protected Excel spreadsheet, and this spreadsheet was stored on a hard drive. Only the authors had access to the data.

clinical_study.condition: Disability Adjusted Life Years of Sub-arachnoid Hemorrhage in Senegalese Cohort

study_pop.textblock: We recruited 448 patients between 2011 and 2020. However, 60 patients (13.4%) had incomplete records and were excluded from the analysis. Herein we present the retrospective analysis of the 388 patients (86.6%) with complete records. We received a median of 40.0 patients annually (IQR=51.5), and a peak was observed in 2017 when 76 SAH patients were admitted at our institution.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sub-arachnoid Hemorrhage admission
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not admitted for sub-arachnoid hemorrhage
